page.title: 10 BONFIRE IN LEWES
page.content: Lewes' six{Bonfire Societies}take over the streets on November 5th. Led by brass bands and lit by thousands of flaming torches, adults and children march around the town in superb {costumes. Flaming tar barrels}are tossed in the river and the{burning {effigy}of a sixteenth century Pope is a reminder that fourteen Protestants were martyred in Lewes during the Marian Persecution of the l6th century Then huge{bonfires}are lit on the edge of town accompanied by elaborate {firework displays,}and an effigy of an unpopular modern figure is exploded. People come to watch from miles around, and those 2000 Lewesians who are Bonfire members spend the rest of the year raising funds and meeting to create fabulous costumes:{Cliffe: Cavaliers and Vikings;{Commercial {Square:}Cowboys and Indians.
